definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
(dialect) to do a body search/to frisk

sentences.english: Identical antibodies called monoclonal antibodies can be generated in large amounts against a therapeutic or diagnostic target.
sentences.chinese: 單克隆抗體可以在治療或診斷用靶子引導下大量產生。

sentences.english: The targets vary from fixed target, running game target to flying target.
sentences.chinese: 雙向飛碟或飛靶射擊中使用的靶子。

sentences.english: Pride like that makes Mensa an easy 2)target for critics.
sentences.chinese: 這種驕氣使得曼沙成爲批評者容易攻擊的靶子。

sentences.english: He lodged the arrow in the target.
By punishing them, Sony became a target of their considerable wrath.
sentences.chinese: 懲罰了他們，索尼公司成爲發泄他們憤怒的靶子。

sentences.english: He took careful aim, squinting down the rifle barrel.
sentences.chinese: 他順着槍筒眯着眼睛，認真瞄準靶子。

sentences.english: The target was perforated by bullets .
sentences.chinese: 靶子上全是子彈打穿的孔。

sentences.english: A tall, black man threw sharp knives on a living target.
sentences.chinese: 一個高大的黑人正朝活靶子上扔尖刀。

sentences.english: The bow can shoot the target in the distance only when stretched to its full extent.
sentences.chinese: 只有拉滿弓才能射得到那麼遠距離的靶子。

sentences.english: An AT Gun by its self is easy meat for a sniper.
sentences.chinese: 一個單獨的反坦克炮簡直就是狙擊手的活靶子。

sentences.english: The soldier level(l)ed his rifle at the target.
sentences.chinese: 士兵舉起步槍瞄準靶子。

sentences.english: I'd be scared to death to be up so high. You're like a target at that height.
sentences.chinese: 這麼高嚇死人，位於那麼高的地方必定成爲靶子。

sentences.english: He took careful aim,squinting down the rifle barre.
sentences.chinese: 他順着槍筒眯着眼睛，認真瞄準靶子。

sentences.english: Anyhow, Gagan should keep his eye on the target.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎麼說，納郎應該盯着靶子。

sentences.english: Not many of the arrows hit the target.
sentences.chinese: 哪句話表達的是箭射中靶子的更多？

definition: those on our side/ourselves/one's own people/one of us
to shoot dead (with a gun, or bow and arrow)
to open fire/to shoot a gun
